metadata.title: CVE-2016-9560 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in the jpc_tsfb_getbands2 function injpc_tsfb.c in JasPer before 1.900.30 allows remote attackers to haveunspecified impact via a crafted image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjasper-runtime - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4
libjasper1 - 1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jasper package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.900.1-14ubuntu3.4').
